greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n minus (product of run lengths in binary representation of n)
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4096
example: For 8, "1000" in binary, the run lengths are 1 and 3, 1*3=3, and 8-3 = 5, thus a(8)=5. For 24, "11000" in binary, the run lengths are 2 and 3, 2*3=6, and 24-6 = 18, thus a(24)=18.
program: (Scheme): (define (A227190 n) (- n (A167489 n))) ;; The Scheme-program for A167489 is found under that entry.
a227190 n = n - a167489 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 05 2013
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 04 2013
